A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data
draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-06 draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-07
Abstract Abstract
Network platforms use Model-driven Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to Network platforms use Model-driven Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to
continuously stream information, including both counters and state continuously stream information, including both counters and state
information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that
the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document
specifies the data manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the specifies the data manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the
platform manifest and the data collection manifest). These YANG platform manifest and the non-normative data collection manifest).
modules are specified at the network (e.g. controller) level to These YANG modules are specified at the network level (e.g., network
provide a model that encompasses several network platforms. The data controllers) to provide a model that encompasses several network
manifest must be streamed and stored along with the data, up to the platforms. The data manifest must be streamed and stored along with
collection and analytics systems in order to keep the collected data the data, up to the collection and analytics systems in order to keep
fully exploitable by the data scientists and relevant tools. the collected data fully exploitable by the data scientists and
Additionally, this document proposes an augmentation of the YANG-Push relevant tools. Additionally, this document specifies an
model to include the actual collection period, in case it differs augmentation of the YANG-Push model to include the actual collection
from the configured collection period. period, in case it differs from the configured collection period.

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
Network platforms use Model-driven Telemetry (MDT), such as YANG-Push Network platforms use Model-driven Telemetry (MDT), such as YANG-Push
[RFC8641], to continuously stream information, including both [RFC8641], to continuously stream information, including both
counters and state information. counters and state information.
This document specifies what needs to be kept as metadata to ensure This document specifies what needs to be kept as metadata to ensure
that the collected data can still be interpreted correctly throughout that the collected data can still be interpreted correctly throughout
the collection and network analytics toolchain. When streaming YANG- the collection and network analytics toolchain. When streaming YANG-
structured data with YANG-Push [RFC8641], there is a semantic structured data with YANG-Push, there is a semantic definition in the
definition in the corresponding YANG module definition. This is the corresponding YANG module definition. This is the semantic
semantic information for the collected data nodes: While this information for the collected data nodes: While this semantic is
semantic is absolutely required to correctly decode and interpret the absolutely required to correctly decode and interpret the data,
data, understanding the network platform and collection environment understanding the network platform and collection environment
contexts information is equally important to interpret the data. contexts information is equally important to interpret the data.
One part of this information is the actual collection period, as One part of this information is the actual collection period, as
opposed to the configured collection period. On some platforms, that opposed to the configured collection period. On some platforms, that
period can be adjusted automatically by the platform, for instance to period can be adjusted automatically by the platform, for instance to
reduce the load incurred by sending the telemetry. To later exploit reduce the load incurred by sending the telemetry. To later exploit
the collected data, getting this actual collection period is crucial. the collected data, getting this actual collection period is crucial.
This document defines a YANG model augmenting the YANG-Push model This document defines a YANG model augmenting the YANG-Push model
[RFC8641] to expose the actual collection period in Section 4 . [RFC8641] to expose the actual collection period in Section 4 .
This document introduces the data manifest, which is composed of two This document introduces the data manifest, which is composed of two
YANG data models, namely, the platform manifest and the data YANG modules, namely, the platform manifest and the data collection
collection manifest, in order to keep the collected data exploitable manifest, in order to keep the collected data exploitable by the data
by the data scientists and relevant tools. scientists and relevant tools.
The platform manifest contains information characterizing the The platform manifest contains information characterizing the
platform streaming the telemetry information, while the data platform streaming the telemetry information, while the data
collection manifest contains the required information to characterize collection manifest contains the required information to characterize
how and when the telemetry information was metered. The platform how and when the telemetry information was metered. The platform
manifest is specified in Section 5. The data collection manifest is manifest is specified in Section 5. An example of data collection
specified in Section 6. manifest is specified in Section 6. The latter module is non-
normative due to the lack of design-time schema mount in YANG, see

the telemetry. The collected data is likely to be transformed into the telemetry. The collected data is likely to be transformed into

scope of this document. scope of this document.

collected, three elements are necessary: the time of data emission, collected, three elements are necessary: the time of data emission,
the originating platform and the subscription through which the data the originating platform and the subscription through which the data
arrived. The approach proposed in this document delegates the time arrived. The approach described in this document delegates the time

of the YANG modules for devices, which focus on describing the of the YANG modules for devices, which focus on describing the
current state of the device, rather than the evolution of that state current state of the device, rather than the evolution of that state
through time. through time.

capitals, as shown here. capitals, as shown here.
Platform: equipment of the network able to produce telemetry. Platform: equipment of the network able to produce telemetry.
Data manifest: The necessary data required to interpret a telemetry Data manifest: The necessary data required to interpret a telemetry
information. information.
Platform manifest: part of the data manifest that completely Platform manifest: part of the data manifest that completely
characterizes the platform producing the telemetry information characterizes the platform producing the telemetry information.
Data collection manifest: part of the data manifest that completely Data collection manifest: part of the data manifest that completely
characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered. characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered.
Datapoint: an instance of data collected via telemetry at a specific Datapoint: an instance of data collected via telemetry at a specific
time. time.
Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry. Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry.

3.2. New Device Onboarding 3.2. New Device Onboarding
When a new device is onboarded, operators have to check that the new When a new device is onboarded, operators have to check that the new
device streams data with YANG-Push, that the telemetry data is the device streams data (e.g., with YANG-Push), that the telemetry data
right one, that the data is correctly ingested in the collection is the right one, that the data is correctly ingested in the
system, and finally that the data can be analyzed (compared with collection system, and finally that the data can be analyzed
other similar devices). For the last point, the data manifest, which (compared with other similar devices). For the last point, the data
must be linked to the data up to the collection and analytics system, manifest, which must be linked to the data up to the collection and
contains the relevant information. analytics system, contains the relevant information.
3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking 3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking
The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are: The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are:
* Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align * Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align
business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of
responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of
bounded context to individual data products where each domain is bounded context to individual data products where each domain is
responsible for (and owns) its data and models. responsible for (and owns) its data and models.

products. products.
The most relevant concept for this document is the "Data as a The most relevant concept for this document is the "Data as a
Product" principle. The data manifest fulfills this principle as the Product" principle. The data manifest fulfills this principle as the
two YANG data models, platform manifest and the data collection two YANG data models, platform manifest and the data collection
manifest, along with the data, provide all the necessary information manifest, along with the data, provide all the necessary information
in a self-describing way for easy consumption. in a self-describing way for easy consumption.

module: ietf-platform-manifest module: ietf-platform-manifest

+--ro platform* [id] +--ro platform* [id]
+--ro id string +--ro id string
+--ro name? string +--ro name? string
+--ro vendor? string +--ro vendor? string
+--ro vendor-pen? uint32 +--ro vendor-pen? uint32
+--ro software-version? string +--ro software-version? string
+--ro software-flavor? string +--ro software-flavor? string

based on [RFC8345]. The platform identifier should be the same as should be the same as the identifier used in inventories or the
the identifier used in inventories or the 'node-id' in [RFC8345]. As 'node-id' in [RFC8345]. As an example, the identifier could be the
an example, the identifier could be the 'sysName' from the ietf- 'sysName' from [RFC3418]. The scope of the "ietf-platform-manifest"

The platform manifest is characterized by a set of parameters The platform manifest is characterized by a set of parameters
('name', 'software-version', 'software-flavor', 'os-version', 'os- ('name', 'software-version', 'software-flavor', 'os-version', and
type') that are aligned with the YANG Catalog 'os-type') that are aligned with the YANG Catalog
[I-D.clacla-netmod-model-catalog] so that the YANG Catalog could be [I-D.clacla-netmod-model-catalog] so that the YANG Catalog could be
used to retrieve the YANG modules a posteriori. The vendor of the used to retrieve the YANG modules a posteriori. The vendor of the
platform can be identified via its name 'vendor' or its PEN number platform can be identified via its name 'vendor' or its PEN number
'vendor-pen', as described in [RFC9371]. 'vendor-pen', as described in [RFC9371].
The platform manifest also includes the contents of the YANG Library The platform manifest also includes the contents of the YANG Library
[RFC8525]. That module set is particularly useful to retrieve the [RFC8525]. That module set is particularly useful to retrieve the

filters or the subtree filters. Xpath filters are based on module filters or the subtree filters. Xpath filters are based on module

The platform manifest is obtained by specifying the new fields 5.2. "ietf-platform-manifest" YANG module
defined above and mounting the YANG library module, along with the
YANG Revisions augmentations. Thus, the YANG Library part is not
repeated in the YANG module for the platform manifest.

9. Security Considerations 9. Security Considerations
The YANG modules specified in this document define a schema for data This section is modeled after the template described in Section 3.7
that is designed to be accessed via network management protocols such of [I-D.ietf-netmod-rfc8407bis].
as NETCONF [RFC6241] or RESTCONF [RFC8040]. The lowest NETCONF layer
is the secure transport layer, and the mandatory-to-implement secure The "ietf-platform-manifest" module defines a data model that is
transport is Secure Shell (SSH) [RFC6242]. The lowest RESTCONF layer designed to be accessed via YANG-based management protocols, such as
is HTTPS, and the mandatory-to-implement secure transport is TLS NETCONF [RFC6241] and RESTCONF[RFC8040]. These protocols have to use
[RFC8446]. a secure transport layer (e.g., SSH [RFC6242], TLS [RFC8446] and QUIC
[RFC9000]) and have to use mutual authentication.
The Network Configuration Access Control Model (NACM) [RFC8341] The Network Configuration Access Control Model (NACM) [RFC8341]
provides the means to restrict access for particular NETCONF or provides the means to restrict access for particular NETCONF or
RESTCONF users to a preconfigured subset of all available NETCONF or RESTCONF users to a preconfigured subset of all available NETCONF or
RESTCONF protocol operations and content. RESTCONF protocol operations and content.
Some of the readable data nodes in this YANG module may be considered Some of the readable data nodes in this YANG module may be considered
sensitive or vulnerable in some network environments. It is thus sensitive or vulnerable in some network environments. It is thus
important to control read access (e.g., via get, get-config, or important to control read access (e.g., via get, get-config, or
notification) to these data nodes. These are the subtrees and data notification) to these data nodes. Specifically, the following
nodes and their sensitivity/vulnerability: subtrees and data nodes have particular sensitivities/
vulnerabilities:
* ietf-plaftorm-manifest:platforms/platform contains details about * platforms/platform contains details about the platform that an
the platform that an attacker could use to find the known attacker could use to find the known vulnerabilities of the
vulnerabilities of the platform. platform.

designed to be accessed via YANG-based management protocols, such as
NETCONF [RFC6241] and RESTCONF[RFC8040]. These protocols have to use
a secure transport layer (e.g., SSH [RFC6242], TLS [RFC8446] and QUIC
[RFC9000]) and have to use mutual authentication.
The Network Configuration Access Control Model (NACM) [RFC8341]
provides the means to restrict access for particular NETCONF or
RESTCONF users to a preconfigured subset of all available NETCONF or
RESTCONF protocol operations and content.
Some of the readable data nodes in this YANG module may be considered
